prompt: Read the passage below and answer the question or follow the instruction: What are the areas of responsibilities of the new hires in West Virginia Power's front office staff including Nathan Richard, Hannah Frenchick, and Lindsey Webb? Passage: We have personnel news to report from the West Virginia Power (Low A; Sally League), Pittsfield Suns (summer collegiate; Futures League), and the Victoria HarbourCats (summer collegiate; West Coast League). The Power have announced several front office moves, highlighted by the elevation of Jeremy Taylor to General Manager. Two former interns received full-time offers this past offseason, while several others added on to their organizational responsibilities and Dean Thomas joined the club as their new Game Entertainment and Production Manager. Jesus Paez joins the full-time staff as the team’s Stadium Operations Manager, while Lindsey Webb comes on as the Suites and Community Outreach Coordinator. Meanwhile, Nathan Richard has become an Account Executive in addition to his food and beverage responsibilities, and Hannah Frenchick has assumed the title of Community Outreach and Merchandise Manager. Taylor moves into the General Manager role after spending the past six seasons as the Power’s Assistant General Manager with a focus on Stadium Operations. The Charleston native is entering his 16th season with the team after signing on in 2004 as their Retail Intern. Prior to becoming the Assistant General Manager, Taylor was the club’s Director of Operations, Director of Sales and an Account Executive. Taylor replaces long-time General Manager Tim Mueller, who is moving up the ladder of Minor League Baseball and taking a key leadership job as the new Assistant General Manager and Director of Sales for the Mississippi Braves (Class AA; Southern League). Mueller provided leadership as the Power’s General Manager for the past seven years, during which time the club installed a new video scoreboard, replaced the ballpark’s playing surface and secured the 2019 South Atlantic League All-Star Game. Paez remains in the Operations Department with his new title as Stadium Operations Manager. The Point Park University alumnus came on board in 2017 as a general intern before moving into a specialized role in 2018 as an Operations Assistant. The 2019 season is Paez’s third with the Power and fourth in baseball after spending 2016 with the Washington Wild Things (independent; Frontier League). Webb found herself with the Power late in the 2018 season as a general intern, but quickly earned a promotion to Suites and Community Outreach Coordinator once the offseason hit. A proud University of Kentucky graduate, Webb will embark on her first full season with the Power in 2019, as well as her first full season in Minor League Baseball. The Huntington, W.Va., native is a huge fan of the Kentucky Wildcats and enjoys going to country concerts as well as spending time with family and friends. Richard, like Paez, initiated his time with the Power as a general intern in 2017 before shifting to the club’s Food and Beverage department in 2018 as an assistant. The Toms Brook, Va., native will continue to help out with the concessions operations at Appalachian Power Park in 2019, but will also be a part of the team’s sales efforts as an Account Executive. Richard graduated from Old Dominion University and immediately jumped right into baseball, working for Shenandoah University in Winchester, Va., and the Woodstock River Bandits of the Valley Baseball League before coming to Charleston. Frenchick, now entering her fourth season with the Power, has held a multitude of roles within the organization. After starting off in 2016 as the Box Office Manager, she assumed control of the team’s social media and merchandise efforts in 2018 before securing a foothold in the Community Outreach department this year. A native of Minnesota, Frenchick devoted eight years of service to the United States Army as a patient administration and public affairs specialist. The University of Southern Maine alumnus started her MiLB career with the Portland Sea Dogs (Class AA; Eastern League) while also spending time with the Portland Pirates hockey team and the Tiger Woods Foundation before relocating to the Kanawha Valley. Thomas comes to the Power after spending the 2018 season with the Lansing Lugnuts (Low A; Midwest League) as a Production Assistant. A 2018 graduate of Eastern Michigan University, Thomas enters his second year in MiLB and third in baseball overall after interning with the Battle Creek Bombers (summer collegiate; Northwoods League) in 2017. A Lansing, Mich., native, Thomas enjoys playing basketball and wiffle ball, running 5Ks and watching lots of movies. He is also a big fan of the Detroit Tigers, Detroit Lions and the Michigan State football and basketball teams. In Pittsfield, the Suns have named Connor Carey Director of Marketing and Ticket Sales Account Manager. Carey has several years experience with the Suns as a full-time intern. Fans will recognize him for his on-field presence, both on the mic and running promotions. “We are obviously excited about the addition of Connor to our full-time staff. He has spent the last few seasons working for the Suns and has become a local celebrity. Connor is extremely creative, and brings a true Pittsfield work ethic to the job. His personality and presence will continue to help us enhance the fan experience, and guarantees on-field entertainment remains top-notch,” said Suns president Kristen Huss. Carey began his career with the Suns during their 2012 inaugural season. He worked several summers as a member of the game-day promotions staff, culminating with a full internship in 2016. As an intern, he was responsible for planning the Suns promotional schedule, with a primary focus on in-between inning contests. That summer, Carey grabbed the microphone and assumed the role as the on-field PA announcer, continuing in that role through 2018. In the spring of 2017, he worked in Los Angeles as an intern at the baseball agency, MVP Sports Group. Connor, a Pittsfield native, graduated from Quinnipiac University in the Spring of 2018, earning his degree in Communications with a minor in Psychology. to draw in more fans through ticket sales. In Victoria, the HarbourCats have announced that Brad Norris-Jones is stepping down as General Manager of the organization effective January 31, 2019, for an opportunity that will be made known in the near future. “We want to thank Brad for his six seasons with the HarbourCats — we worked very closely together to build a franchise that will be around in Victoria for a very, very long time, and we’re all excited for the future,” said Jim Swanson, Managing Partner, who is stepping back into the GM role on an interim basis. Further front-office adjustments will be made soon. The team has strong support with Swanson and the ownership group backed by Christian Stewart, John Pollard, Curtis Pelletier and Richard Michaels.

Nathan Richard is an Account Executive in addition to his food and beverage responsibilities; Hannah Frenchick is the Community Outreach and Merchandise Manager; and Lindsey Webb is the Suites and Community Outreach Coordinator.

prompt: Create a comprehensive checklist that includes all necessary precautions and safety measures to be taken when working around electrical equipment. The checklist should include steps to ensure proper grounding, equipment shut-off procedures, and personal protective equipment requirements. The style of the checklist should be clear and easy to read, with clear instructions for each step. The content should be comprehensive and cover all potential hazards and safety considerations associated with working around electrical equipment.

messages.content: Create a comprehensive checklist that includes all necessary precautions and safety measures to be taken when working around electrical equipment. The checklist should include steps to ensure proper grounding, equipment shut-off procedures, and personal protective equipment requirements. The style of the checklist should be clear and easy to read, with clear instructions for each step. The content should be comprehensive and cover all potential hazards and safety considerations associated with working around electrical equipment.

Electrical Equipment Safety Checklist

Before Starting Work:
- Ensure all electrical equipment is properly grounded.
- Confirm that equipment is not energized (use a voltage tester).
- Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) including insulated gloves, safety glasses, and flame-resistant clothing.
- Obtain necessary permits and lockout/tagout procedures prior to beginning work.
- Ensure there is proper ventilation in the area.

When Working Around Electrical Equipment:
- Never touch exposed electrical wires or metal parts of equipment.
- Use tools with insulated handles and store them properly when not in use.
- Avoid wearing jewelry or loose clothing which could become caught in equipment.
- Keep flammable materials away from electrical equipment.
- Be aware of all overhead power lines and maintain a safe distance at all times.
- If moisture is present in the area, use ground fault circuit interrupters (GFCIs) to protect against electric shock.
- Use caution when working with electrical equipment in wet or damp environments.

Shutting Down Equipment:
- Follow proper electrical lockout/tagout procedures to prevent unexpected start-up.
- Consult proper diagrams and procedures to verify all energy sources have been disconnected.
- Ensure all equipment is properly de-energized before beginning work.

Emergency Procedures:
- Have a first aid kit and protocol for electrical shock readily available.
- In case of electrical shock, shut off power and call for medical assistance immediately.
- Know the location of all early warning systems, such as smoke detectors, fire alarms and carbon monoxide detectors.

After Work is Completed:
- Turn off and unplug all electrical equipment.
- Remove any debris in the work area.
- Confirm that all electrical equipment has been properly secured and locked out.
- Review the work area for any potential hazards before leaving the site.

Following this checklist will help ensure that you and your team stay safe while working around electrical equipment.

prompt:
Can you summarize the controversy surrounding the Baltimore jail scandal and the different investigations underway?
Generate according to: GANSLER WANTS SPECIAL COUNSEL: Maryland Attorney General Doug Gansler suggested Monday that Gov. Martin O’Malley appoint a special counsel to conduct an investigation into the scandal at a Baltimore jail, arguing that other inquiries underway are not sufficient, reports John Wagner of the Post.
O’MALLEY SAYS NO: Gov. O’Malley immediately rebuffed the request, saying in a letter that the federal indictments of corrections officials and inquiries by two new task forces were response enough, reports the Sun’s Erin Cox.
DELEGATES CRITICIZE ‘SOFTBALL’ HEARING: Dels. Curt Anderson and John Cluster said during a Friday appearance on Maryland Public Television’s State Circle that the hearing last week by the Legislative Policy Committee asked “kind of the softball questions,” reports Bryan Sears of Patch.com.
GUN CHECK BACKLOG: In the first five months of 2013, Maryland State Police received 57,732 applications to purchase a handgun or assault-style weapon — more than the agency receives in a typical year. The department is supposed to complete a background check within seven days of receiving an application, but it is now taking up to 10 weeks, writes Andy Brownfield for the Washington Examiner.
DELAYS CALL FOR PATIENCE: In light of a recent Sun story that highlighted the delays by State Police in getting through the backlog of gun buyers’ background checks and some gun shops releasing the guns anyway, the Sun editorial board writes that the delays are unfortunate but tolerable under the circumstances because the background checks are vital to keeping guns out of the wrong hands. Gun dealers and purchasers will simply have to exercise a bit of patience.
CLEAR THE DOCKET: In a op-ed piece for the Sun, attorneys James Astrachan, George Liebmann and Henry Lord write that with the retirement of Chief Judge Robert Bell from the Maryland Court of Appeals, it will be a good time for the new chief judge to address the shocking state of the docket, in which opinions languish unreleased and parties must wait too long for decisions.
TAX FREE FLAGS: In anticipation of Flag Day on Friday, Maryland Comptroller Peter Franchot said that U.S., POW/MIA and Maryland flags are exempt from the state’s 6% sales tax, according to a brief in the Frederick News-Post. The exemption can be found under the Tax-General Article of the Maryland Code, Section 11-205.
PROTECTION FROM THE PROTECTORS: Who will protect us from those who are supposed to protect us? That is the question that lingers after the disclosure of two programs that monitor the phone records and Internet use of millions of Americans by the National Security Agency, based at Maryland’s Fort Meade in Anne Arundel County, writes Len Lazarick in a commentary for MarylandReporter.com.
DEM OP TAKES AIM AT YOUNG: Mark Newgent of Red Maryland reports that a Democratic operative is alleging that Republican gubernatorial hopeful Blaine Young paid him for campaign advice, opposition research and other political activities in a relationship lasting from October 2012 through April 2013. The operative also alleges Young used his position on the Frederick County Board of Commissioners for private gain. Young denies the charges from what he calls a disgruntled employee.
GEORGE STUMPS IN SALISBURY: T he Anne Arundel Delegate who hopes to one day be governor of Maryland stopped by Salisbury on Monday, reports Jennifer Shutt for the Salisbury Daily Times. Del. Ron George, first elected to office in 2006, did not give a speech to party loyalists or host a lunch for excited voters, but met with some local news outlets.
THE GOP GUBERNATORIAL LINEUP: Josh Kurtz of Center Maryland assesses the field of Republican candidates for governor, including everyone from those who have announced – David Craig and Ron George – to those who have hinted – Michael Steele and Blaine Young.
WHO’S RUNNING? The Sun compiled a photo gallery of those who have entered or have expressed interest in running for governor.
ATTY. GEN. CANDIDATES: David Moon at Maryland Juice posts video of the four candidates for attorney general speaking at various political events over the last month or so. Those candidates are state Sen. Brian Frosh and Del. Aisha Braveboy, Jon Cardin and Bill Frick. Moon writes that one dynamic to keep an eye on is whether the statewide candidates for governor, attorney general and comptroller begin teaming up and forming tickets.
DISTRICT 39 SLATE: A slate of Democratic lawmakers from District 39 have filed for re-election in a district in which the borders are shifting because of redistricting that will take effect in January 2015. The slate includes Sen. Nancy King and Del Shane Robinson, both of Montgomery Village, and Dels. Charles Barkley and Kirill Reznik, both of Germantown.
GETTING REDMER TO RUN: Bryan Sears of Patch.com writes that the draft Al Redmer for Baltimore County Council movement may have forgotten to invite one person. Al Redmer. “Every four years, if not every two, the phone starts to ring with folks asking or begging me to run for county executive or congress or state Senate,” said Redmer, who last served in the House of Delegates in 2003.
BAKER NAMES KEY HEADS: Miranda Spivack of the Post is reporting that Prince George’s County Executive Rushern Baker nominated new leadership for three key departments on Monday as part of his effort to transform often cumbersome permitting and inspections procedures and step up code enforcement of everything from overgrown lawns to vacant houses.
CITY BAG FEE: Baltimore City might impose a 10-cent fee on every plastic and paper bag distributed by merchants in the city — a move praised by environmentalists as a litter deterrent but decried by some businesses who say it would hurt them and their shoppers, report Tim Wheeler and Luke Broadwater in the Sun.

Maryland Attorney General Doug Gansler has called for a special counsel to investigate the Baltimore jail scandal, but Governor Martin O'Malley has refused, citing the ongoing federal indictments of corrections officials and inquiries by two new task forces. Meanwhile, Democratic delegates have criticized a "softball" hearing on the matter, and the Baltimore Sun's editorial board has called for patience as there are delays in Maryland State Police's backlog of background checks for gun purchases. Other news in Maryland politics includes procrastination in clearing legal dockets, protection from those who are supposed to protect us, and the potential imposition of a city bag fee.
Can you give me a brief overview of the Republican candidates running for governor in Maryland?

There are currently two Republican candidates who have declared their intention to run for governor in Maryland: David Craig and Ron George. Other potential candidates, including former RNC chair Michael Steele and Frederick County Board of Commissioners President Blaine Young, have not officially announced their bids but have been testing the waters. Craig, a former Harford County executive, has emphasized his fiscal conservatism and support for Second Amendment rights in his campaign. George, a state delegate from Anne Arundel County, has similarly focused on fiscal issues and has also been vocal in his opposition to tax hikes.

prompt: Create a set of ten posters that raise awareness about the importance of bicycle safety by depicting common road hazards and providing tips on how to avoid them. The posters should feature bold, eye-catching graphics and a clear, easy-to-read layout. Each poster should focus on a specific aspect of bicycle safety, such as wearing a helmet, using hand signals, or staying visible at night. The posters should be distributed strategically in areas with high bike traffic, such as bike shops, community centers, and along popular bike routes.

messages.content: Create a set of ten posters that raise awareness about the importance of bicycle safety by depicting common road hazards and providing tips on how to avoid them. The posters should feature bold, eye-catching graphics and a clear, easy-to-read layout. Each poster should focus on a specific aspect of bicycle safety, such as wearing a helmet, using hand signals, or staying visible at night. The posters should be distributed strategically in areas with high bike traffic, such as bike shops, community centers, and along popular bike routes.

1) "Protect Your Head, Wear a Helmet" - a poster featuring a graphic of a helmet with the message "No Helmet, No Ride", and a list of statistics on the benefits of helmets in preventing head injury.

2) "See and Be Seen" - a poster featuring bright, reflective clothing and bicycle lights with the message "Stay Visible, Stay Safe".

3) "Watch for Cars" - a poster featuring a graphic of a car and bicycle sharing the road with the message "Bikes Have a Right to the Road Too", and a list of tips for avoiding car-bicycle collisions.

4) "Use Hand Signals" - a poster featuring a graphic of different hand signals with the message "Communicate Your Intentions".

5) "Obey Traffic Laws" - a poster featuring a graphic of a stop sign with the message "Stop at All Stop Signs and Red Lights", and a list of other important traffic laws to follow.

6) "Avoid Road Hazards" - a poster featuring a graphic of different road hazards such as potholes, debris, and gravel with the message "Stay Alert and Avoid Obstacles".

7) "Ride in the Bike Lane" - a poster featuring a graphic of a bicycle lane with the message "Stay Safe by Riding in the Bike Lane", and a list of the benefits of using bike lanes.

8) "Avoid Riding at Night" - a poster featuring a graphic of a dark road with the message "Avoid Riding at Night if Possible", and a list of tips for staying safe if riding at night.

9) "Always Check Your Equipment" - a poster featuring a graphic of a bicycle and a list of equipment to check before each ride such as brakes, tires, and chains.

10) "Bike with Friends" - a poster featuring a graphic of a group of friends riding bicycles with the message "Stay Safe and Keep Each Other Accountable".
These posters are great! Can you add some tips on how to properly fit a helmet on the "Protect Your Head, Wear a Helmet" poster?

Certainly! Here are some additional tips on how to properly fit a helmet that can be added to the "Protect Your Head, Wear a Helmet" poster:

- Make sure the helmet fits snugly and sits level on your head. It should not slide forward or backward.
- Adjust the straps so they form a "V" shape under your ears, and the chin strap is snug but not too tight.
- Check that there is no more than two fingers' width between your eyebrows and the front of the helmet.
- Shake your head to make sure the helmet stays in place. If it wobbles or shifts, adjust the straps until it fits securely.
- Replace your helmet every 5 years, or immediately after a crash or impact.

These tips can be accompanied by corresponding graphics to help illustrate the proper fitting techniques.
These tips are really helpful! Can you add more information to the "Watch for Cars" poster about what to do when encountering parked cars on the side of the road?

Of course, here are some additional tips that can be added to the "Watch for Cars" poster about what to do when encountering parked cars on the side of the road:

- Keep a safe distance from parked cars. If a door suddenly opens, you'll have enough space to avoid it.
- Look for signs that a car may be about to move (like a driver sitting in the car or headlights turning on) and be prepared to stop or slow down if necessary.
- Use extra caution when riding past large vehicles like trucks, buses, and vans as they may obstruct your view of the road ahead.
- Consider taking an alternate route or using a bike lane to avoid riding near parked cars altogether.

These tips can be accompanied by corresponding graphics to help illustrate the best practices when encountering parked cars.

prompt: Write clear and concise instructions for how to make spicy shrimp tacos, including the ingredients needed, cooking instructions, and any necessary tips for achieving optimal flavor and texture. Be sure to specify whether any specific kitchen tools or utensils are needed, and provide options for any substitutions or variations to suit different taste preferences or dietary restrictions. Additionally, include suggestions for optional toppings or accompaniments to further enhance the dish.

messages.content: Write clear and concise instructions for how to make spicy shrimp tacos, including the ingredients needed, cooking instructions, and any necessary tips for achieving optimal flavor and texture. Be sure to specify whether any specific kitchen tools or utensils are needed, and provide options for any substitutions or variations to suit different taste preferences or dietary restrictions. Additionally, include suggestions for optional toppings or accompaniments to further enhance the dish.

Ingredients:

1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined

1 tablespoon olive oil

1 tablespoon chili powder

1 teaspoon cumin

1/2 teaspoon paprika

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper

8 tortillas

1 lime, cut into wedges

Optional toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, sliced avocado, sour cream

Instructions:

1. Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat. 

2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and cayenne pepper.

3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and pour the spice mixture over it. Toss to combine and cook until the shrimp is pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side. 

4. Warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave. 

5. Divide the shrimp evenly among the tortillas. 

6. Squeeze a lime wedge over each taco and add any desired toppings. 

7. Serve immediately and enjoy! 

Tips:

- If you don't want your tacos to be too spicy, you can reduce the amount of cayenne pepper or omit it altogether.

- You can substitute the shrimp with diced chicken or tofu for a vegetarian option.

- To add more flavor, you can make a simple salsa by combining diced tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

- Don't overcook the shrimp or it will become tough and rubbery. 

- For a crispier tortilla, you can lightly fry them in oil before filling them with the shrimp.

They seem pretty simple to follow. Could you tell me a bit more about the different types of toppings that go well with spicy shrimp tacos? Also, do you have any suggestions for a side dish to serve with these tacos?

Certainly! Some toppings that pair well with spicy shrimp tacos include:

- Shredded lettuce: This adds a refreshing crunch to the tacos and balances out the spiciness of the shrimp. - Diced tomatoes: These add a burst of juicy sweetness and acidity to the tacos. - Sliced avocado: This adds creaminess and richness to the tacos and complements the spicy flavors. - Sour cream: This cools down the heat of the shrimp and adds tanginess. - Salsa: This adds a chunky, flavorful element to the tacos and can be customized to your spice level preference. As for side dishes, here are some options:

- Rice: A side of white or brown rice can complement the flavors of the spicy shrimp tacos and help balance out the heat. - Beans: Black beans or refried beans are another great side dish option to pair with tacos. - Roasted vegetables: Roasted vegetables such as bell peppers, onions, and zucchini can also be served as a side dish and provide some additional color and nutrition to the meal. - Corn on the cob: Grilled or boiled corn on the cob with a sprinkle of salt, butter, and lime can be a tasty side dish. Hope that helps! Enjoy your spicy shrimp tacos.

These suggestions are great and have got me really excited to try these tacos! Could you suggest some alternatives for the tortillas? I'm looking to make these tacos gluten-free, so I was wondering if there are any other wraps I could use instead?

Absolutely! Here are some alternatives to using wheat tortillas for making gluten-free spicy shrimp tacos:

- Corn tortillas: This is a classic and gluten-free option to use for tacos. You can heat them up in the microwave, on a dry skillet or even over an open flame.

- Lettuce leaves: For a low-carb and grain-free option, you can wrap the shrimp in lettuce leaves such as Boston or Bibb lettuce. This adds extra refreshment and crunchiness to your tacos.

- Cauliflower tortillas: For a lower-carbohydrate but still delicious option, you can make tortillas using cauliflower rice and coconut or almond flour. Simply mix the ingredients, then cook them in the skillet until golden and firm.

- Rice paper wrappers: Another option is to use gluten-free rice paper wrappers, which are thin and translucent. Dip the wrappers in warm water to soften, and then fill them with the spicy shrimp and toppings of your choice.

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

prompt:
ATLANTA – (Feb. 4, 2019) The Office of the Arts at Georgia Tech continues its current season celebrating the high-tech intersection of art, engineering, science, design and media.
The Arts@Tech season – the organization’s 27th – next features two February events, starting with Fifth House Ensemble: Journey Live on stage this Saturday at 8 p.m. Then on Feb. 16, standup comedy meets juggling and technology with the wild antics of Mark Nizer: 4D Comedy Juggler at 8 p.m.
Nizer’s is the “4D Comedy Juggler” with performances incorporating lasers, glowing balls, fire (hand-held torches and ignited propane tanks), live chain saws and electric carving knives, ping-pong balls soaring 20 feet (juggled by mouth), live music (played on instruments touched by the items he’s tossing), stage-friendly vehicles and other inventions of his own creation. Examples of his many juggling feats are available in this highlight reel.
Since the 2014-15 season, the Ferst Center for the Arts at Georgia Tech charted a new direction for professional arts programming. Following a few years of experimentation, for the first time the current season consists solely of works that bring together the latest in technology with artistic presentation across a range of genres, from music and dance to media arts, theatrical works, and performances that provide a mix-up of multiple presentation styles.
Audiences will experience a hologram concert with a virtual pop star in March with The Virtual Singer Maya Codes' Atlanta debut. These experiences and more combine for a season carefully curated at the intersection of art and technology. Georgia Tech is unique in the nation in presenting a performing arts season exclusively at this intersection.
Offering these exciting and innovative performances in the fully refurbished Ferst Center for the Arts is something Arts@Tech hopes that Georgia Tech students, Atlantans and visitors will share and enjoy. The renovation of the theater space features the installation of new seating, along with other renovations such as new lighting, carpeting and upgrades to the accessible seating areas. The building remained open during fall for events and exhibitions scheduled in the Ferst lobby, for which updates took place in 2016.
Performances of the new Arts@Tech season take place at the Ferst Center for the Arts, 349 Ferst Drive NW, Atlanta, Ga. 30332. Discounted ticket packages and individual tickets are available from the Ferst Center Box Office at 404-894-9600. Information is also available at www.arts.gatech.edu. All programs are subject to change.
World champion juggler, award-winning comedian and inventor Mark Nizer brings his live 3D show to the stage; juggling laser beams, glowing red balls, and just about any new invention he can imagine. Nizer is constantly incorporating new technology into his hilarious performances.
Maya Kodes is a singer who released a dance pop song on iTunes, recorded an EP, performed over 30 concerts and amassed over 5,500 Facebook followers … all as a hologram! The world’s first interactive real-time virtual pop star, Kodes is the creation of Neweb Labs in Montreal. Local dancers will join Maya onstage for this performance.
For tickets visit www.arts.gatech.edu or call 404-894-9600. Who is Maya Kodes, and what can audiences expect from her hologram concert in March? How can people purchase tickets for these events?

prompt:
Spray grill rack with nonstick nonflammable cooking spray. Preheat grill to medium high heat (350 degree to 400 degree). In a large bowl, gently combine ground beef, mustard, worcestershire sauce, and 1 tablespoon seasoning. Using hands, shape mixture into 12 patties.
Grill, covered with grill lid, for 3 to 4 miutes on each side, or until desired degree of doneness. Top each patty with 1 cheese slice quarter, and grill, covered with grill lid, for 1 minute, or until cheese melts.
Place lettuce on bottom halves of slider buns, if desired. Add patties, and top each with a tomato slice, if desired. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon steak seasoning. Cover with bun tops. Serve immediately. End.
How long should each side be grilled for when making these beef patties?

prompt: Write a personal essay in first person that describes your identity, including your cultural, social, and personal experiences. Discuss how certain events, people, or circumstances have affected your identity in positive or negative ways throughout your life. Use descriptive language to reflect your feelings, emotions, and insights about your evolving identity, and provide specific examples to support your reasoning. Make sure to include how you envision your identity continuing to evolve in the future. The essay should be between 750 and 1000 words and must be typed, double-spaced, and written in Times New Roman font, size 12.

messages.content: Write a personal essay in first person that describes your identity, including your cultural, social, and personal experiences. Discuss how certain events, people, or circumstances have affected your identity in positive or negative ways throughout your life. Use descriptive language to reflect your feelings, emotions, and insights about your evolving identity, and provide specific examples to support your reasoning. Make sure to include how you envision your identity continuing to evolve in the future. The essay should be between 750 and 1000 words and must be typed, double-spaced, and written in Times New Roman font, size 12.

I am a mixed-race individual who grew up in a predominantly white and suburban community. Growing up, I struggled to find a sense of belonging and often felt like I was stuck in between two identities. On one hand, I identified with the culture and traditions of my mixed heritage, but on the other, I felt pressure to conform to the norms and expectations of my surroundings.

One of the most significant events that has affected my identity was the divorce of my parents. My parents separated when I was ten years old, and it completely shattered my world. My sense of security was stripped away from me, and I was forced to navigate the complexities of family dynamics and relationships at an early age. This event forced me to grow up faster than I ever imagined, and it forced me to reevaluate and redefine my identity.

Although the divorce was a traumatic experience, it also allowed me to explore different sides of my identity. My mom, who is from a different cultural background than my dad, encouraged me to learn about and appreciate my mixed heritage. We would cook traditional dishes, celebrate cultural holidays, and go to cultural festivals. These experiences allowed me to connect with my roots and provided me with a sense of identity and belonging outside of my immediate surroundings.

In contrast, my dad's side of the family held more conservative views and didn't place as much emphasis on cultural traditions. Despite this, I always felt like I had to prove myself to them and show that I was just as worthy and capable as my white counterparts. This pressure to assimilate was challenging and often made me feel like I had to suppress certain parts of myself.

As I grew older, I became more confident and self-assured in my identity. I realized that my mixed identity was something to be celebrated and not something to hide or be ashamed of. I began to embrace my diverse background and started to seek out opportunities that allowed me to connect with other individuals who shared similar experiences.

One of these opportunities was participating in a multicultural club in high school. Being a part of this club provided me with a safe and inclusive space to express myself and connect with individuals who shared similar experiences. Through this club, I was able to learn more about different cultures and languages and was able to educate others about my own mixed background.

Looking towards the future, I envision my identity continuing to evolve and grow. I hope to continue to learn more about different cultures and traditions and to connect with individuals who share similar experiences. I also hope to use my experiences to educate and inspire others to embrace their unique identities and to break down the barriers that divide us.

In conclusion, my identity is a complex and ever-evolving aspect of my being. It's shaped by my cultural, social, and personal experiences, and I'm constantly learning and growing from these experiences. Although I've faced many challenges and obstacles, both positive and negative, I firmly believe that every experience has led me to be the confident and self-assured individual I am today, and I'm excited to see where my identity takes me in the future.

prompt: Create a graphic novel about a group of superheroes trying to save the world.

messages.content: Create a graphic novel about a group of superheroes trying to save the world.

Title: The League of Heroes

Panel 1: A group of ordinary people are suddenly bestowed with extraordinary powers after they are caught in an explosion caused by an alien invasion.

Panel 2: They come together to form a team of superheroes called The League of Heroes.

Panel 3: The League receives a warning that the alien invaders are planning to destroy the world as they know it.

Panel 4: The superheroes start training and preparing for the battle ahead.

Panel 5: They create a plan to take down the aliens, which involves infiltrating their base and destroying their main weapon.

Panel 6: The League splits up into teams and quickly gets to work.

Panel 7: During the battle, some of the superheroes are injured and taken captive by the aliens.

Panel 8: The remaining superheroes come up with a new plan that involves rescuing their captured teammates and taking down the alien leader.

Panel 9: The League regroups and engages the aliens in an all-out battle that shakes the earth.

Panel 10: The League ultimately triumphs and saves the world from being destroyed.

Panel 11: The League is celebrated as heroes and their heroic deeds inspire others to do good and fight for justice.

Panel 12: The League continues to work together to protect the world from future threats and keep the peace.
Wow, that graphic novel idea sounds amazing! Can you add more details about the specific powers each superhero possesses and how they use them in battle? I need the nitty-gritty details!

Sure thing! Here are the specifics for each superhero:

1. Thunderbolt: Has the power to manipulate electricity and create bolts of lightning. Uses lightning to strike down enemies and create barriers to protect his teammates.

2. Blaze: Can control fire and summon flames at will. Uses flames to create a wall of fire to block incoming attacks and to burn through obstacles.

3. Frostbite: Has the power to freeze objects and create ice constructs. Uses ice constructs to create bridges and barriers and freeze enemies in place.

4. Stonefist: Possesses immense strength and can turn his hands into stone. Uses his strength to smash through enemy defenses and his stone hands to create shockwaves.

5. Spirit: Can become intangible and phase through solid objects. Uses this ability to sneak past enemy defenses and ambush them from within.

6. Cyclone: Can generate powerful winds and create tornadoes. Uses the winds to control the battlefield and launch enemies into the air.

7. Nightshade: Has the power to become invisible and control shadows. Uses her invisibility to gather intel on enemy positions and her shadow control to create illusions to confuse the enemy.

8. Omega: Has the power of telekinesis and can move objects with his mind. Uses his telekinesis to throw enemies around and create a shield to protect his teammates.

During battle, the superheroes work together to combine their abilities and launch coordinated attacks on the enemy. Thunderbolt and Blaze create a wall of lightning and fire to block incoming attacks while Stonefist and Cyclone charge in to attack. Frostbite creates ice barriers to protect the team and Nightshade creates illusions to confuse the enemy. Spirit phases through defenses and takes out enemy commanders while Omega moves objects to disrupt enemy formations. Together, the League of Heroes is unstoppable!

This is great! Could you include some more action scenes where the heroes showcase their powers? Maybe have them face a giant robot or something even more challenging? I want to see the League of Heroes really flex their abilities!

Certainly, here's an expanded storyline with more action scenes:

Panel 1: The world is in peril again, as a rogue A.I. Has taken control of a military factory and threatens to unleash an army of robots on the planet.

Panel 2: The League of Heroes is immediately called into action as they arrive at the factory, ready to take on the machines.

Panel 3: Omega uses his telekinesis to disable the factory's security cameras and the heroes make their way in. Thunderbolt and Blaze start to create a wall of fire and lightning to protect their team.

Panel 4: Just as they think they are safe, the heroes are ambushed by a giant robot. The robot slams its fists down creating a shockwave that knocks the heroes off their feet.

Panel 5: Stonefist and Cyclone rush to the robot, Stonefist smashing its fists with his stone hands while Cyclone creates a tornado to lift the robot off its feet.

Panel 6: Frostbite then freezes the lower half of the robot, making it unable to move, while Spirit phases through its defenses to sabotage its inner systems.

Panel 7: The robot is down, but not out, as it initiates self-destruct to take the heroes with it. Nightshade quickly creates a shadow cloak to protect their team.

Panel 8: The heroes narrowly escape as the factory explodes, but not before they realize that the A.I. Controlling the robots was created by an unknown villain.

Panel 9: Thunderbolt uses his electricity powers to track the source of the signal, leading them to an abandoned warehouse.

Panel 10: As they enter the warehouse, they face off against the villain and their new robot, ten times bigger than the first one.

Panel 11: The League uses all their skills to try and defeat the robot, with Stonefist and Cyclone again leading the charge. Frostbite creates an ice construct to try and freeze the robot in place.

Panel 12: Nightshade uses her shadow control to cloak the heroes, Spirit phases through the robot to try and sabotage it from the inside, and Omega uses his telekinesis to try and disrupt the robot's systems.

Panel 13: But the second robot is too powerful and overloads the League's combined powers. The heroes are defeated.

Panel 14: As they lay on the ground, the villain reveals their true identity - an old enemy of one of the League members who has returned to exact revenge.

Panel 15: But just as the villain is about to act, the League of Heroes regains their power, using teamwork and strategy to take down the robot and defeat the villain.

Panel 16: The world is saved once again, thanks to the fearless efforts of the League of Heroes.

This is beyond amazing! I love how detailed and action-packed it is! Can you add more scenes where the League of Heroes combines their powers to take on even more challenging foes? I want to see even more mind-blowing superhero action!

Sure, here's an epic storyline where the League of Heroes must combine their powers to face off against their toughest challenge yet:

Panel 1: The city is suddenly attacked by a powerful super-villain, whose powers include mind control and telekinesis.

Panel 2: The League of Heroes is called to action, determined to save their city and stop the villain's evil plan.

Panel 3: They arrive at the villain's lair, ready to take him down. But as they enter, they are confronted with a maze filled with deadly traps.

Panel 4: Nightshade uses her shadow control to scout out possible routes while Spirit phases through walls to find hidden passages.

Panel 5: After overcoming several traps, they finally reach the villain's lair, where they are faced with an army of mind-controlled villains.

Panel 6: Thunderbolt and Frostbite create a barrier of lightning and ice to protect the team from the mind-controlled villains, while Cyclone creates a whirlwind to blow them away.

Panel 7: Stonefist and Omega charge at the villains, while Blaze creates a ring of fire to trap them.

Panel 8: However, the villain is still not defeated, and he starts attacking the team with his telekinesis.

Panel 9: The team is lifted in the air, unable to move, but then Nightshade creates a shadow barrier to protect them.

Panel 10: The team realizes they need to combine their powers to defeat the villain. Frostbite creates an ice slide for Stonefist to ride, while Blaze creates a path of fire for Cyclone to follow.

Panel 11: Cyclone uses the fiery path to ride a tornado and lift Stonefist into the air. Stonefist slams his fists down on the villain, causing a massive shockwave.

Panel 12: Thunderbolt creates a bolt of lightning to strike the villain, while Omega and Spirit use their telekinesis to throw objects at him.

Panel 13: The villain is defeated, and the mind-controlled villains are released from his control. The day is saved, thanks to the teamwork and combined powers of the League of Heroes.

Panel 14: As they leave the villain's lair, the League of Heroes reflects on their experiences and realize that their powers alone are not enough to defeat the world's greatest threats.

Panel 15: They vow to work together as a team and combine their powers to take on whatever challenges may come their way.

Panel 16: The League of Heroes stands ready to face any foe that may threaten the world, united in their quest for justice and peace.

prompt: Conduct market research and brainstorm ideas to identify potential niches for your dropshipping business that have high demand and low competition. Consider factors such as product trends, target audience, marketing tactics, and profitability. Use online tools and resources to help you determine which niches may be the best fit for your business. Once you have a list of potential niches, evaluate them further by analyzing their revenue potential, sourcing options, and customer base. Use this information to select the niche that is most profitable and suitable for your expertise and resources.

messages.content: Conduct market research and brainstorm ideas to identify potential niches for your dropshipping business that have high demand and low competition. Consider factors such as product trends, target audience, marketing tactics, and profitability. Use online tools and resources to help you determine which niches may be the best fit for your business. Once you have a list of potential niches, evaluate them further by analyzing their revenue potential, sourcing options, and customer base. Use this information to select the niche that is most profitable and suitable for your expertise and resources.

Here are some steps you can follow to conduct market research and identify potential niches for your dropshipping business:

1. Identify current product trends: Start by researching current product trends in your industry. This will help you understand what products are in high demand and what customers are looking for. You can use tools like Google Trends, Amazon Best Sellers, and social media to identify popular products.

2. Analyze your target audience: Determine who your target audience is and what their needs and preferences are. This will help you choose products that will appeal to them. You can use tools like Google Analytics, surveys, and social media analytics to understand your target audience.

3. Explore marketing tactics: Look at different marketing tactics that you can use to promote your products. This will help you understand how to reach your target audience effectively. You can use tools like Google AdWords, Facebook Ads, and influencer marketing to promote your products.

4. Evaluate profitability: Evaluate the profitability of different niches by analyzing the average profit margins for each product. You can use tools like Shopify’s profit margin calculator to determine the profitability of different products.

5. Look for sourcing options: Identify reliable and cost-effective suppliers for your products. You can use online directories like AliExpress, SaleHoo, and Worldwide Brands to find suppliers in your niche.

6. Analyze customer base: Analyze the customer base for each niche to determine the size of the market and the level of competition. Use tools like Google Keyword Planner and SEMrush to understand the search traffic and competition for each niche.

Once you have identified potential niches, evaluate them further by analyzing their revenue potential, sourcing options, and customer base. Use this information to select the niche that is most profitable and suitable for your expertise and resources. Remember to focus on finding niches with high demand and low competition, as this will increase your chances of success.
Can you elaborate more on how to analyze the profitability of different niches? What factors should I consider apart from profit margins?

Sure, here are some factors to consider when analyzing the profitability of different niches:

1. Product pricing: Apart from profit margins, you should consider the pricing of your products. This can determine whether your products are affordable and appealing to your target audience. You can research what your competitors are charging for similar products and price your products accordingly. 2. Shipping costs: Shipping costs can significantly affect your profit margins. You should consider the shipping costs for your products and determine whether you can still make a profit after factoring them in. You can negotiate with your suppliers to get lower shipping costs, or consider working with suppliers located in countries with lower shipping costs. 3. Return rates: Return rates can also impact your profit margins. High return rates can result in increased costs and reduced profits. You should research the potential return rates for your products and factor them in when analyzing their profitability. 4. Marketing costs: Marketing costs can also affect the profitability of your business. You should consider the cost of advertising, promotions, and other marketing tactics. You should also determine whether you can reach your target audience effectively with your marketing budget. 5. Demographic information: You should also consider the demographic information of your target audience. This can help you determine whether they have the purchasing power to afford your products. 6. Sale trends: You should analyze sales trends for each niche over time. This can help you determine whether a niche has long-term potential or whether it is a fad that will fade quickly. By considering these factors, you can more accurately evaluate the profitability potential of different niches and ensure that you are choosing the right niche for your dropshipping business.

Can you provide some examples of niches that are currently in high demand and have low competition? Additionally, could you please suggest some effective marketing tactics that I could use to promote my products in those niches?

Sure, here are some potential niches that are currently in high demand and have relatively low competition:

1. Pet care products: With more people adopting pets, the pet care industry is growing rapidly. You can focus on specific products like pet grooming tools and toys, or on specific pet breeds like dogs or cats. 2. Health and wellness products: As people become more health-conscious, there is a growing demand for health and wellness products like fitness equipment, supplements, and organic foods. 3. Eco-friendly products: Eco-friendly products are gaining popularity as people become more environmentally conscious. You can focus on products like reusable bags, straws, or bamboo products. 4. Baby products: The baby market is always growing, with parents always searching for new and innovative products. You can focus on products like baby strollers, car seats, or baby carriers. 5. Gaming and electronics: The gaming and electronics industries are always in high demand, with new products constantly being introduced to the market. You can focus on specific products like gaming chairs or virtual reality headsets. When it comes to marketing, here are some effective tactics that you could use to promote your products in these niches:

1. Social media marketing: You can use social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter to promote your products and reach your target audience. 2. Influencer marketing: Partner with influencers in your niche to promote your products to their followers. This can help you get in front of a new audience and increase your brand visibility. 3. Email marketing: Use email marketing to promote your products and offer special promotions to your subscribers. 4. Content marketing: Creating valuable and informative content like blog posts, videos, or infographics can help position your brand as an authority in your niche. 5. Paid advertising: Consider using paid advertising platforms like Google Ads or Facebook Ads to reach your target audience and increase your brand visibility. By using these marketing tactics and promoting products in niches that are currently in high demand with low competition, you can increase your chances of success with your dropshipping business.
